verbs.description: daddle (third-person singular simple present daddles, present participle daddling, simple past and past participle daddled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, archaic or dialectal) To walk unsteadily; totter; dawdle
examples: I had to wait an hour at the station for the coming of his train. It was passed pleasantly in reading, ' The Victory Won,' an interesting narrative of the salvation of a sceptical physician. When uncle arrived, he and I daddled along a pretty narrow lane.

entries.meaning: (slang, obsolete) The hand or fist; used in the phrase "tip us your daddle" meaning "give me your hand".
